metadata.title: CVE-2017-17558 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - low
metadata.description:
The usb_destroy_configuration function in drivers/usb/core/config.c in theUSB core subsystem in the Linux kernel through 4.14.5 does not consider themaximum number of configurations and interfaces before attempting torelease resources, which allows local users to cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds write access) or possibly have unspecified other impact viaa crafted USB device.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17558` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
